page.title: 03People and Housing Warbleton
page.content: The population of approximately 400 people is sprinkled over the area with a higher density at Rushlake Green (RG) and Turner's Green. In those areas the number of people living alone,mainly elderly,is significantly higher. In RG there are no children under 5 and only 4 under l7, whereas just outside the village there are higher numbers of children. This reflects the higher price of central RG properties. The majority of families are first generation in the area although some 20% go back more than 3 generations in East Sussex.It is interesting to note that there are only 2 council owned properties and 9 out of l0 homes have a telephone. Even the most outlying houses have power and water but there are no gas lines and Calor gas provides an alternative.
